message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how to reproduce the tower exactly as shown, using only the block shapes/orientations given in the dictionary (no re‐orienting or rotating beyond what is pictured).

1)  DESCRIPTION OF THE TARGET TOWER
•  Total Blocks: 7  
   – 2 Red “arch” blocks  
   – 2 Tall Yellow rectangular blocks  
   – 1 Green upright rectangular block  
   – 1 Orange vertical cylinder  
   – 1 Orange wedge “roof”  
•  Layering & Layout:
   – Bottom Layer: Two red arch‐blocks side by side (arches facing front).  
   – Middle “Tower”:
       • A tall orange cylinder sits centrally on top of the red arches.  
       • Two tall yellow blocks stand behind the cylinder, forming the yellow backdrop.  
       • A green upright block is placed at the back right side.  
   – Topmost Piece: An orange wedge rests atop the cylinder, creating the “roof.”  

2)  SELECTING THE CORRECT BLOCK INDICES
Matching each visible piece in shape, color, and orientation from the dictionary yields:
• Red Arch Block  → Index 1  (use two copies for the base)  
• Tall Yellow Block (vertical)  → Index 8  (use two copies, side by side)  
• Green Upright Rectangular Block  → Index 6  
• Orange Vertical Cylinder  → Index 11  
• Orange “Roof” Wedge (slopes front‐to‐back)  → Index 15  

3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
Use the following sequence (you may vary it if you wish, but here is one logical bottom‐to‐top order):

{  
   Step1: Move block with index 1 (place first red arch for the left side)  
   Step2: Move block with index 1 (place second red arch for the right side)  
   Step3: Move block with index 8 (place first tall yellow block behind the left side)  
   Step4: Move block with index 8 (place second tall yellow block behind the right side)  
   Step5: Move block with index 6 (place the green upright block at the right rear)  
   Step6: Move block with index 11 (position the orange vertical cylinder on top of the red arches)  
   Step7: Move block with index 15 (cap the cylinder with the orange wedge “roof”)  
}
